definitions.definition: a line along which two pieces of fabric are sewn together in a garment or other article.
examples: join, stitching; suture the seam was coming undone

definitions.definition: a line where the edges of two pieces of wood, wallpaper, or another material touch each other.
a long thin indentation or scar.
examples: a sun-scorched face fissured with delicate seams

definitions.definition: an underground layer, as of ore or coal.
examples: layer, stratum, vein, lode a seam of coal
it can be used for seaming garments

definitions.definition: make a long narrow indentation in.
examples: men in middle age have seamed faces
